intro: Peucedanum carvifolium subsp. heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the carrot family (Apiaceae) and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and thrives in woodland or meadow habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional herbal medicine. Its subspecies status reflects genetic variation in leaf morphology and flowering time compared to the main species.
